problem_text:
For every pro-p-group G of (2 × 2)-matrices for p ̸= 2 an analogue of the Tits Alternative holds: either G is soluble, or the variety of pro-p-groups generated by G contains the group ⟨(1 t; 0 1), (1 0; t 1)⟩ ≤ SL2(Fp[[t]]) (A. N. Zubkov, Algebra and Logic, 29, no. 4 (1990), 287–301). Is the same result true for matrices of size ⩾3 for p ̸= 2?
A. N. Zubkov
